name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-008 Conduit and Pit Installation & Checklist - Rev.5
template name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-008 Conduit and Pit Installation & Checklist - Rev.5

name: Ref docs - Issued drawings / Site copy drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Check that you have the latest site and engineering drawings BEFORE starting each task/set of tasks.
Acceptance Criteria - Lots to be broken up accordingly and outlined on a lot map
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Underlying services and/or assets have been installed prior to commencing works over and/or above.
Acceptance Criteria - Peg location of proposed underground services with levels from pit to pit. Peg property boundaries
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.7]
Acceptance Criteria - Conduit system shall be a Category A wiring enclosure for an underground wiring system to AS/NZS3000 and AS/NZS 3013.
○ No corrugated conduit or similar shall be used under any circumstances.
○ HV & LV Conduits: Shall be orange heavy-duty uPVC, sizes as per drawings otherwise min 150mm (HV) and 100mm (LV) to be used.
○ Comms Conduits: Shall be white heavy-duty uPVC, sizes as per drawings otherwise min 100mm to be used.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.11]
Acceptance Criteria - All pits are to be reinforced concrete complete with concrete lids. All lids shall be gatic with min load classification of Class D in accordance with AS 3996.
○ Pits lids shall be fixed to prevent unauthorised access.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6, 6.11]

Acceptance Criteria - All conduits shall be surrounded by a min of 100mm compacted sand unless shown otherwise on the drawings. For power conduits, this compacted sand must have a min thermal rating of 1.2°C.m/W.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - All trenches unless otherwise directed by Snowy Hydro shall be excavated as per Drawings.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Pits shall be installed on a compacted sand base of not less than 100mm.
○ Bedding layer to be compacted for the full width of the trench to a depth of 100mm for Comms & 150mm for Power Conduits.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.11, Cl.17.1], Drawings

Acceptance Criteria - Conduits to be installed as per the drawings in a straight line where possible and with no changes in diameter between pits. Joints to be sealed with a solvent cement or glue as per manufacturer recommendations.
Minimum separation to be 150mm for DN150 conduits and 100mm for all other sizes unless shown otherwise on the drawings
Minimum depth of cover to conduits to be:
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.7]
Acceptance Criteria - All conduit bends shall be long sweep bends with a maximum 90-degree angle.
Min bend radius shall suit the min cable bending radius of the largest cable in the conduit and generally not be less than 1000mm.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.9]

Acceptance Criteria - Orange Polyethylene marker tapes, 150mm wide and 0.1mm deep, shall be laid in the trench directly over all underground conduits at approximately 50% of the depth of cover. The tape shall be marked with the warning:
or similar in black letters that will not fade.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6]
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill the full width of trench with compacted sand to above the level specified for compacted sand, back to natural surface level.
○ Layers not to exceed 150mm compacted thickness.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Spec. 1112 Earthworks (Roadways) [Cl 4.13, 7.1]

Acceptance Criteria - Each layer to be compacted to a density that is no less than the density of the existing adjacent material. If the existing material density is unknown, minimum relative compaction to be:
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.10]
Acceptance Criteria - Install Concrete Cable markers on the surface of all underground cable joints, at every change in direction, and on straight runs at least every 30m.
○ Markers to be a 400mm square and 100mm deep concrete block with a brass label attached. Label to identify conduit type and direction.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - All trenches unless otherwise directed by Snowy Hydro shall be excavated as per Drawings.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Pits shall be installed on a compacted sand base of not less than 100mm.
○ Bedding layer to be compacted for the full width of the trench to a depth of 100mm for Comms & 150mm for Power Conduits.
Acceptance Criteria - Pits to be installed as per drawings and manufacturers specifications.
○ All conduit entries are to be fitted with proprietary bell-mouths installed flush with the pit wall.
○ All pit joints and bell-mouths are to be mastic sealed or glued as per manufacturer recommendations.
Acceptance Criteria - Pits to be installed with a drainage system as per the drawings to prevent pooling of water
Acceptance Criteria - Pits deeper than 600 to be fitted with galvanised plastic-coated step irons as per AS1657
Acceptance Criteria - Pits to be fitted with Class D Concrete Infill Gatic Lids to AS 3996.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.11], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Brass marker plates to be installed at each pit showing cable/conduit routes, contact phone number, organisation & drawing number.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6]
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill the full width of trench with compacted sand to above the level specified for compacted sand, back to natural surface level.
○ Layers not to exceed 150mm compacted thickness.
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.6], Spec. 1112 Earthworks (Roadways) [Cl 4.13, 7.1]

Acceptance Criteria - Each layer to be compacted to a density that is no less than the density of the existing adjacent material. If the existing material density is unknown, minimum relative compaction to be:
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0002 General Electrical Installation [Cl 6.7.5]
Acceptance Criteria - Draw ropes or wires to be installed in all conduits that will require further cabling.
○ All conduits to be mandrel inspected prior to cabling to check for blockages.
Acceptance Criteria - An as-built survey of the conduit and pit system has been completed to ensure all structures are within construction tolerances.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
5.2 - Acceptance and closure of non-conforming items
Acceptance Criteria - NCRs to be opened for non-conforming items and closed prior to closing construction lot.
